newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Minsa launches 158.9 mln peso share offer.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Minsa launches 158.9 mln peso share offer.

text.p: Grupo Minsa, Mexico's second largest corn flour producer, launched Tuesday its previously-announced simultaneous, mixed public share offer for 158.9 million pesos, Minsa's share offer prospectus said.

The offer is for 35.5 million ordinary C type II shares without voting rights, which represent 21.08 percent of the share capital of the company, Minsa said in the prospectus published in national newspapers.
In Mexico, 14.2 million shares will be sold, 11,645,600 in an initial public offering (IPO) and 2,554,400 in a secondary offering, the company said.

The share issue price is 11.19 pesos per share, the offer period is March 18-19 and the company will be registered on the Mexican Stock Exchange from Tuesday. Liquidation date for shares is March 24, the company said.

Also, Minsa will issue 2,130,000 American Depositary Shares (ADSs), representing 21.3 million ordinary shares at a ratio of one to 10 in the United States and other countries under the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission's Section 144-A and "S" system, the company said.
In Mexico, Minsa is offering an overallotment of 2.13 million ordinary shares, and in the ADS program, an added amount of of 319,500 ADSs, the company said.
If the two overallotments are fully subscribed, Minsa will have floated 40,825,000 shares, representing 24.24 percent of the company's share capital, the company added.
